body:
I'm building a tree full of applications and letting Spack automagically generate the module files for me.

`module avail` with yesterdays tree works.  `module avail` with today's tree recurses (apparently) and eventually crashes with a stack overflow:

```
/blah/apps/spack/0.0.3/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/lua-5.3.4-m3fkb5muas3vnroeftkvukvevvzduw6w/bin/lua: ...7gqf75y6u4op734f6iomhew4j7v/lmod/lmod/libexec/Spider.lua:374: stack overflow
stack traceback:
        ...7gqf75y6u4op734f6iomhew4j7v/lmod/lmod/libexec/Spider.lua:374: in upvalue 'l_build_parentT_helper'
[...]
```

There are only a few differences.

If you can't stand the suspend, please check out the real Cry For Help that I made in the Lmod repository: https://github.com/TACC/Lmod/issues/245
title: lmod: wrong configuration leads to infinite recursion problem.
